heroIntro: This 3-bedroom, 2-bathroom apartment in Santa Pola represents a compelling investment opportunity in one of Costa Blanca's most sought-after coastal destinations. Priced at €320,000, this property offers premium specification at a significant discount—40% less expensive than comparable properties on Spanish island markets—while commanding strong rental demand year-round. The location near Estación de autobuses provides excellent accessibility while maintaining proximity to Santa Pola's renowned beaches, making it attractive to both short-term holiday renters and long-term residents. At €3,678 per square meter, this represents premium value compared to the Santa Pola average of €2,200/m², reflecting the property's quality finishes and investment potential. areaSection: Santa Pola is a dynamic Mediterranean coastal town located 25 minutes south of Alicante city center in the Valencian Community. This working port town combines authentic Spanish character with modern amenities, attracting both investors and residents seeking genuine coastal living beyond typical tourist zones. The town benefits from its position on the Costa Blanca's southern stretch, enjoying 300+ days of sunshine annually with mild winters averaging 12°C. Santa Pola's natural harbor provides economic vitality through fishing and commerce, while its designation as a Blue Flag beach destination reflects environmental quality and cleanliness standards. The town's established infrastructure—including hospitals, schools, and shopping centers—supports year-round habitation rather than seasonal tourism. Geography-wise, Santa Pola sits between Alicante and Torrevieja, offering convenient access to both urban amenities and quieter Mediterranean villages.
lifestyleSection: Daily life in Santa Pola revolves around Mediterranean rhythms with cosmopolitan conveniences. The established expat community—primarily British, Dutch, and Scandinavian—means English is widely spoken in shops, restaurants, and professional services, eliminating common relocation anxieties. Weekly farmers markets offer fresh produce at Spanish prices, while international supermarkets (Mercadona, Lidl, Consum) provide familiar products. Beach access defines leisure time here—multiple Blue Flag beaches within 20 minutes support swimming, sailing, and water sports year-round. The promenade features quality restaurants specializing in fresh seafood and paella, while tapas bars provide affordable evening entertainment. Healthcare access rivals Northern European standards, with English-speaking doctors and private clinics complementing public facilities. For active retirees and working professionals, championship golf courses, tennis clubs, and cycling routes provide structured recreation. The slower pace compared to Alicante city, combined with reliable infrastructure and international community support, creates an appealing quality-of-life proposition without sacrificing practical amenities.
investmentSection: This property exemplifies smart coastal real estate investment in an emerging market. Santa Pola's real estate market has appreciated 8% year-on-year, substantially outpacing national averages while remaining 40% cheaper than Balearic Island equivalents. The rental market is particularly robust—comparable 3-bedroom apartments command €800 per week (€3,200 monthly) during peak seasons, with shoulder-season rates of €600 weekly maintaining occupancy year-round. Conservative annual estimates suggest €25,000-€30,000 gross rental income, translating to 7.8-9.4% gross yield—exceptional by European standards. Santa Pola's position as an undervalued alternative to overcrowded Costa Blanca hotspots (Benidorm, Playa del Inglés) means continued appreciation as international investors discover superior value and authentic Mediterranean living. The established expat community drives consistent holiday let demand, while new infrastructure investments (port improvements, local development) suggest sustained capital growth over five-year investment horizons.

The property's premium specification at 40% discount versus island markets, coupled with proven €800/week holiday let demand and 8% annual market appreciation, positions it for reliable 7-9% gross returns. Beyond financial metrics, the established expat infrastructure, Mediterranean lifestyle, and practical amenities create intrinsic value supporting both rental performance and owner occupation flexibility. faqs.question: Hoeveel kost dit eigendom?
faqs.answer: €320,000. This 3-bedroom apartment represents excellent value for investment-focused buyers, particularly when considering typical weekly rental rates of €800 and the 8% annual market appreciation trend in Santa Pola. faqs.question: Is de Costa Blanca een goede plek om eigendom te kopen?
faqs.answer: Yes. Costa Blanca offers exceptional value compared to other European coastal destinations, with established infrastructure, reliable healthcare, English-language support, and strong tourism-driven rental demand. The region's 300+ annual sunshine days, affordable cost of living, and international community make it attractive for both retirement and investment purposes. Santa Pola specifically provides undervalued positioning compared to overcrowded tourist zones.

faqs.question: Kunnen buitenlanders eigendom kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes. Foreign nationals can purchase property in Spain without restrictions; no Spanish residency or work permit is required for property ownership. The process requires a Spanish tax identification number (NIE), simplified bank account setup, and standard conveyancing through licensed property lawyers. EU citizens face minimal bureaucracy; non-EU buyers complete identical procedures with minimal additional requirements.

faqs.question: Wat zijn de kosten om eigendom te kopen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Typical purchase costs in Spain total 8-12% of property price, including: property transfer tax (3-8% depending on region), notary fees (0.5-1%), property registration (0.5-1%), and lawyer fees (0.5-1%). Additional costs include mortgage-related expenses if financing. For this €320,000 property, expect approximately €26,000-€38,000 in total acquisition costs beyond the purchase price.

faqs.question: Hoeveel bedraagt de onroerende voorheffing in Spanje?
faqs.answer: De jaarlijkse onroerende voorheffing in Spain average 0.4-0.5% of cadastral value (typically lower than market value), translating to approximately €800-€1,200 annually for this property. This Valencian Community property benefits from competitive regional tax rates. Additional costs include municipal taxes (basura, etc.) averaging €300-500 yearly. These costs remain modest compared to Northern European equivalents.

faqs.question: Kan ik als buitenlander een hypotheek krijgen in Spanje?
faqs.answer: Yes. Foreign investors can obtain mortgages from Spanish banks for up to 70-80% of property value, typically at favorable rates (currently 3-4% fixed). Santander, BBVA, and smaller regional banks actively serve international buyers. Requirements include NIE tax identification, bank account documentation, and basic financial verification. Mortgage processes require slightly longer timelines than domestic purchases but remain straightforward for serious buyers.

faqs.question: What is the cost of living in Santa Pola?
faqs.answer: Santa Pola offers exceptional value compared to Northern European equivalents. Monthly living expenses for a couple average €1,200-1,500 including rent/mortgage payments, utilities, groceries, and dining. Healthcare, transportation, and food costs run 30-40% cheaper than UK/Northern Europe while maintaining equivalent quality. Expatriate pensioners commonly budget €1,000-1,200 monthly for comfortable living without entertainment; working professionals spend €1,500-2,000 including social activities.

faqs.question: Hoe is het weer aan de Costa Blanca?
faqs.answer: De Costa Blanca heeft een mediterraan klimaat with 300+ annual sunshine days, mild winters (12-16°C average), and warm summers (28-32°C). Rain is minimal (200mm annually), concentrated in autumn/spring. Winter months rarely require heating; summer temperatures remain manageable with sea breezes. The climate supports year-round beach activity and outdoor living, making it ideal for holiday rentals and permanent residency without seasonal constraints.

faqs.question: What rental income can I expect from this apartment?
faqs.answer: Conservative estimates suggest €25,000-€30,000 annual gross rental income based on €800/week peak season rates and €600/week shoulder-season averages. This translates to 7.8-9.4% gross yield on the €320,000 purchase price—exceptional by European standards. Professional property management companies operating in Santa Pola typically retain 15-20% commission while handling marketing, guest relations, and maintenance logistics. Net yields after expenses typically range 5.5-7% after accounting for property taxes, maintenance, and management costs.

faqs.question: How far is Santa Pola from the UK?
faqs.answer: Santa Pola is approximately 1,400 kilometers (870 miles) from London, requiring 2-3 hours flight time plus airport procedures. Alicante-Elche Airport (35 kilometers away) operates 40+ direct routes to UK cities (London, Manchester, Birmingham, Glasgow, Edinburgh). Flight costs typically range €40-100 return from most UK airports during off-peak periods; budget airlines provide competitive pricing. Flight frequency supports convenient owner management and family visits without logistical complications.
